website_summaries.verdict: Portable Sabrent hub for use with most laptops and small computers.
pros: The base of the small hub rotates around the USB connector so it will fit into small spaces at odd angles
Capable of data transfer speeds of up to 480 Mbps
cons: Older USB 2.0 ports limit the hub compatibility with newer devices and accessories

customer_reviews.title: A real workhorse and dependable.
customer_reviews.text: A real workhorse and dependable. I use this for port on my work computer. That means I plug it in every day and use it all day long. I ordered it because my new computer only has two ports and I needed at least four ports. It always works, it’s very reliable, and I like the fact that once you have your devices plugged into it, it can be left standing straight up or tilted to the side.
customer_reviews.author: Lora Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Never again!
customer_reviews.text: This product start up caused my computer not to boot up after I turned it off... 3 hours went by as I tried to turn my computer on and nothing... After another few minutes I decided to remove it and what do you know, MY COMPUTER STARTED!!! I don't know what's with this thing but rest assured I won't be putting this thing into my computer ever again!!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrd Whodat III

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend to a friend - if I wanted to destroy the friendship. CAVEAT EMPTOR!
customer_reviews.text: For some strange reason, my first attempt at review did not post. I wonder why? There is "junk." Then there is "Junk." Then there is "JUNK." THIS item is "JUNK!!!!!!!!!!!!" (Probably need a few more exclamation points.) This device is supposed to let you convert a single USB port into 4 parallel USB ports. I bought this to use with a voice dictation microphone and a wireless mouse. Not exactly "high-maintenance." Setup worked for 1 day. After that, the USB for the wireless mouse was no longer functional. So not only did I waste money on this little "gem," I also had to go out and buy a new wireless mouse.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised and is convenient. The one ...
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised and is convenient. The one concern is that you have to handle it somewhat delicately as it's one point of stability is the USB port connection. It can move around a bit and could possibly break. THREE MONTH FOLLOW UP: The device is more delicate than anticipated and I have had problems with it connecting and disconnecting from the USB port if lightly touched. On several occasions this has corrupted my USB drive that was hooked into the hub. The housing is in two pieces and not glued together. It comes apart very easily. I can no longer recommend this product due to its poor build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Do not last
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 3 of these in a little over a year. I use them infrequently but despite lack of use, they do not last! Also, my mouse usb receiver barely fits in it. You must force it in. Why do I keep buying them? The design is great. No cords especially for a laptop. Very portable. I need a 2.0 hub. Inexpensive. I wish they would make the same design in a superior product. Certainly, it is better to pay more for something that will last and not give you total frustration. Anyone want a few of these that are fairly new but don't work?
customer_reviews.author: lmc

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay put
customer_reviews.text: I had bought this to replace an almost identical no-name hub which had failed. But this one just wouldn't stay tight in the port on my laptop. If I had any cord that creates any rotational forces at all (from, say, hanging of the edge of the desk, or being brushed by your hand ,or something) the hub loses connection. Aggravating as hell. I replaced it with this unit which does not suffer from this issue as it lays flat against the side of the laptop and can't rotate.
customer_reviews.author: Walt H.

customer_reviews.title: USB outlets too tight.Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I found a great solution. I bought this with the intent of using it on my new rising desk converter for extra USBs. It plugs into the USB on my converter but I can't really plug USB' into it. It is extremely tight. It almost pulled one of my USB's apart. This was a complete waste of money. The only reason I won't return it is it's not worth the $7 refund. So I'll eat the $7. I wish there were other sellers for something like this. I am now afraid to buy this brand "SABRENT" for any other gadgets.
customer_reviews.author: Sonja fruit and greens McKinney

customer_reviews.title: 4 ports is just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have a Macbook Pro and it onky has 2 usb ports. I need more lol. As a teacher I have my printer, wireless mouse, jump drives, charging cable for my wireless pen etc. This was an inexpensive and convenient way t ok get more access to usb ports. The swiveling feature is an added bonus because I can us it on either side of the computer. So far everything has plugged in and worked just fine- I only need to remember to eject my jump drives before disconnecting lol. Great value and price point.
customer_reviews.author: LLO

customer_reviews.title: On my second one, buying another brand next time
customer_reviews.text: I use this at work, since the company laptop only has two USB ports. I always leave it in the same position (horizontal). I always unplug it before putting the laptop in a bag. Yet, it starts misbehaving after about 1.5 years of use. I'm assuming that the mechanical part which allows rotation just goes bad, although I never rotate it. On a Win10 laptop in meeting now, it keeps coming up and going down to the point that I cannot reliably use it. Looking for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Elsy D.

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK WITH iPHONE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Took this on vacation with me thinking it would be a great buy...It was not! I should have tested it before I left, but sadly did not. This does not work with any cord, apple or not. Thank goodness hotels have extra USB ports in the rooms nowadays or I would have been screwed. I am going to keep it reluctantly, as it will charge my non-apple items, but very disappointed this fact was not put in the description of the product.....
customer_reviews.author: Rmsoko

customer_reviews.title: Really versatile
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that I can turn it 180 or 360, so it fits next to other ports. I have a Magic Jack that hogs 2, and this totally handles the problem. I also like that there's no cord hanging out of the computer. Be advised, the ports on it are tight and, at first I thought I wouldn't be able to get even my little wireless mouse into it. But it just takes a little finagling. And I'm confident that nothing's going to just slip out of it. Just got it today, so can't attest to durability, but it seems like pretty sturdy plastic and, without additional the cables, it should do quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene

customer_reviews.title: Comes loose a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like the product idea and really wish it was working better, but if I just bump my laptop a bit, it loses connectivity. It usually reconnects by itself or when I push it in tighter, but it's somewhat of a pain. Plus, it's really hard to insert the USB connectors into the slots. And hard to remove them. I have to pull the whole thing out, then yank the one out I want out, then re-insert the device to my laptop. I think I'll look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: MBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Great little product
customer_reviews.text: Took apart and old netbook to replace the CPU, get a little more "oomph" out of it....I put it back, all seemed well till I found I screwed up something and lost 2 of my 3 USB 2.0 ports (I hated taking it apart in the first place, and don't wish to do so ever again!)....With the 3rd one still functioning, I thought I'd try this device....Runs an antenna booster, a wireless mouse "unifying receiver" (if my Logitech jargon is correct)', and a flash drive w/o a hitch, so what's not to like?
customer_reviews.author: AndyB

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED - plugs don't work
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I got 3 of these plugs and NONE of them work. They must be defected... such a bummer... had to return all of them... I love this little HUB that holds 4 USB all at once and it's super adaptable as the plug-in site turns around 360 degree so It will fit into ANY plugs and it's also very compact. I originally got one but went back and re-order 2 more since my hubby really liked it too. Great product at a great price too!
customer_reviews.author: T & R

customer_reviews.title: Great for a while
customer_reviews.text: This worked wonderfully for me for about 2 months. Now when I barely move anything it unplugs itself and plugs back in which has gotten pretty annoying. I'm disappointed because I love that it is up against your computer instead of dangling off and it has the perfect about of ports for me. I just have to give up and buy a different one because it is very inconvenient to have my mouse, keyboard, and headset come unplugged at random times
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits with a case
customer_reviews.text: 04/15/2020: I have a surface pro. with a case and I have bought several of items like this one but have returned them due to the case which I love. The USB hubs I have bought prior do not fit. However this one does. I have attached pictures. It is bulky which is why overall I took a star away. I sincerely believe they could have made this product less bulky. The material is plasticee but then again what isn't now a days. So far I am satisfied. If anything changes I will update the review.
customer_reviews.author: DAISY

customer_reviews.title: Not very useful
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this so I do not have to crawl under my desk to access more usb ports. The problem is the usb that plugs into the computer is on the end of the hub so every time you try to plug in another usb to the other ports it moves and therefore 50% of the time the computer does not recognize what you plug in unless you wiggle the hub. Not good for the computer that thinks you are plugging and unplugging in a usb device.
customer_reviews.author: LITETHUND

customer_reviews.title: The ports are hard to plug in and take out
customer_reviews.text: All ports work. but Don't plug in your expensive devices. It may ruin your USB. It is very hard to plug in and harder to pull out. I just bought that for my surface tablet for pluging in the wireless mouse and key board, so there will be less wires on my already clutter office desk. It seems to be doing its job. However, I wouldn't use that to transfer data, as it will be slow and may not be powerful enough for hard drive. I don't want to take the risk of losing the data.
customer_reviews.author: Thunder99_us

customer_reviews.title: Works for a while but gets weighed down over time
customer_reviews.text: I used this hub for a fair amount of time and in that time it did work very well. However if you have your laptop on a cooling rack or are using it in an tower the weight of whatever you may plug into it will weigh it down over time, especially if you have the swivel bit set at 90 degrees. This means that the connector no longer sits right, to where you have to jerry rig something to hold it in place or only plug one thing into it at a time, and in that case what's the point? Sabrent has other models of usb hubs that I would sooner recommend over this version.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Cannot use for back of desktop
customer_reviews.text: I know this is a very inexpensive item to write a review about, but when you need it and it does not fit it is very frustrating. I planned to use this to add to my USB slots on the back of my desktop (I only have 2 USB ports). Well, the ports are very close together and this device is too wide--it covers BOTH ports. I planned to buy another one to expand my USB ports to 8 and I counted on the rotation feature to help.
customer_reviews.author: I Read Anything

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE - Constantly disconnects anytime slightly bumped or even lightly touched. Does not stay plugged in.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this from May 2015 to Dec 2016. DO NOT PURCHASE! I am no techie, but all you need to know is once you plug in multiple USB cords, they get too heavy, and you will get CONSTANT DISCONNECTS as this hub gets weighed down. It does not stay snugly in the port. I transcribe for a living and it is horrible to have to find my place all over again when I lose my headphones, my dictation program, my keyboard. Anytime anyone goes near the cord -- my son, my cat, the wind, it gets disconnected and I have to close and re-open programs all the time. VERY INCONVENIENT. BUY the four-port with small cord instead!
customer_reviews.author: traceyellen99

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. After around two weeks, the blue light turns on and that's it. So if you're in the market for a tiny blue glow on the side of your computer this is the one for you. Also, the only angle it went in on my computer was totally inconvenient (heavy side down instead of up). Start using this thing as soon as it is delivered so that you can return it when it stops working after two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Poopkitty

customer_reviews.title: Updated review:  Great customer service, I will try it again.  (Was:  Stopped working after a month. Don't waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: I posted a highly negative review when this broke. Sabrent customer service saw the review and contacted me and sent a new device. No cost to me . Excellent customer service. The new device is installed and working now. Broke in a month. I bought this little USB hub specifically to allow one powered USB port on my TV to power several devices. It worked for a month and now does not work. I checked ports, cables and the devices themselves. Everything powers up fine until i put this in the mix and then the devices aren't working!
customer_reviews.author: The Elephant's Child

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it says it does
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I have a portable usb hub with switches on each, but it was so annoying, and I really needed two more plugs. So, I plugged it into this little gem and now I have two more plugs at my laptop. BUT one of my favorite things about it, which is not mentioned, is that it sits a half an inch away from the surface of the laptop. This is so awesome. I hate hate hate having to find those stupid little ports on the laptop and fumbling around with them. This gives it a little bit of ease which is just brilliant. It does rotate 180 degrees, I just tried it. A handy little gadget!
customer_reviews.author: Dodie's Doodles

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: I love this multi usb slot, Always helps me access my 3 pendrives together.
customer_reviews.author: Anki

customer_reviews.title: Nice hub and works with macOS Catalina, but could use a few improvements
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a USB splitter/hub which would work with macOS Catalina (the latest version of macOS as of writing this review) and tried a couple of other products which didn’t work. This one does, and the 180 swivel is very convenient for use with a laptop which doesn’t allow all that much room to maneuver. My only suggestions would be to remove the logo entirely, or at very least the lighting of it — when it’s bedtime and the lights are out, it will shine. Other than that, a USB 3.0 version would be nice. Great product overall and has been working for me so far.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Junk - couldn't use any of the four usb ports
customer_reviews.text: This was the most poorly constructed item I've seen in a long time. Not one of the ports could be used - they were so misaligned. I couldn't even force a usb dongle into any of them, and gave up so I wouldn't damage the dongles. I thought Sabrent had better quality than that. Very disappointing and now I have to waste my time returning it for a $10 item and finding another product.
customer_reviews.author: LMS

customer_reviews.title: yes it works but if you plan on plugging in a few things please read
customer_reviews.text: This unit works. I put this on my gaming laptop and its like the weight of the devices pulls on the USB hub ( A mouse and a headset ) and it shorts in and out as the USB port rocks around. WHat you end up with is your mic and headset going in and out and your mouse freezing. I would NOT buy this again. Its def a faulty design. Get one with a cable.
customer_reviews.author: FR8Zilla

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not great
customer_reviews.text: I got this for work at home as my lap top only has one USB port. It works ok, bit the ports are a bit quirky. Right now I can even get my mouse dongle out of this adapter because it’s so tight. I was able to charge my head set with it even though it doesn’t claim to be a charging port. Would say it’s adequate, not great.
customer_reviews.author: Telle1

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap Hub
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my laptop. Purchased two of these and had them plugged in on each side. No problem running a keyboard/mouse, charger, and speakers. They started to spin around 360 degrees, which I suspect means something broke inside, but as long as you don't keep spinning it around in the same direction, I guess the wire's won't get tied up. But hey, they still work.
customer_reviews.author: Chazz

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It works well and i am able to plug in my peripherals to my laptop easily without having to plug them in one at a time and remove one at a time. The only thing that i realized after using for the first time, is that when i have my laptop on a stand, the cables plugged into this port are now raised off the table and i feel like they are being strained. The product works great but next time i will get a port with a single cable to connect to the laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Queens NY Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't Fit
customer_reviews.text: Because of the way this is made it will not fit into a port on the back of my PC tower nor will it fit into the back of my new All in One Computer. It will only fit if you have a flat place to plug it into. Don't buy if your USB port that you want to plug it into is recessed. Otherwise, it works great and is good quality, just can't fit it into a recessed area.
customer_reviews.author: 1tnslvr

customer_reviews.title: Good for smaller laptops with few USB ports
customer_reviews.text: Wife's chromebook-like laptop doesn't have enough USB ports for a big memory stick (needed because the machine doesn't have enough hard drive), a wireless mouse dongle, and a connection to anything else. This lets here plug her phone in while still using the mouse. Perfect for this. Negative: it "stands out" a little way from the side of the laptop. I wish it sat flush with the side. Not a big deal, though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product..... But same day deliver did not happen and that is the third time. Watch out for paying this fee.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent port replicator. Most PC laptops have one or two USB ports. Now I have four more.. Much better and easier to add hardware. My issue is that I ordered the same day and it was delivered next day. It seems it is not wise to order same day during holidays. The can't do it. I did need it the same day but I didn't die. Amazon should refund my pre-paid fee for the same day delivery I will call and demand satisfaction and a complete investigation. The product is excellent and not cheaply built even though the price was low.
customer_reviews.author: F-18 driver

customer_reviews.title: Driver will fail in 2 days making it useless. Fail.
customer_reviews.text: This one made it all of 2 days. Then it's driver corrupted. That's a pain but what ever, right? Just search online till you find the right driver, install, restart, fixed? Nope. Turns out this company does not label their devices with a model number so good luck finding the right driver to match your device. Oh, and their model names on Amazon match about 40 different USB devices on their drivers portion of their site, so which one will it be? Downloaded several drivers, none worked. Save your money. But a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: SeaMonkey

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: A great little hub for connecting my wireless mouse and keyboard and still have room for more peripherals. It really swivels easily also.....an added plus since computers come with a lot of arrangements for their ports. This makes it even more adaptable. It can swing from side to side and everywhere in between.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas I.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Solid connection, positive locks on rotation
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Replaced an older hub with a 3" cord. The cord was causing wiggling, and loosing USB connections on the port. This solidly resolved that problem. Being able to swivel and lock the hub at 90° intervals is great for getting it out of the way of interfering with other ports. Older 2.0 version to keep from conflicting with wireless mouse has been great. Zero problems. Solid, lightweight design is great
customer_reviews.author: Russell Miller

customer_reviews.title: A Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my computer and the ports are vertical towards the right. This worked on perfect for me as it still leaves free the upper ports of the computer but has now added four ports, a gain of three, for my other devices. The fit into the computers port is tight enough that the unit pretty much stays in place. A simple device but does exactly what I purchased it for.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B.

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS AND IT’S PORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected!!!! I expected a bigger/bulkier product but when I opened the Amazon box and saw the tiny box, I was excited. Once I opened the tiny box containing the product, I was instantly satisfied. It is portable, it WORKS, it has a light that turns on once connected to power so you never have to guess if it connected or not. And to add to it, the rotating head that connects to the USB port makes it even better. You can have it turned vertically or horizontally to your preference. Great job on this little thing!
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: 4-port USB Extender-takes up a very small space
customer_reviews.text: I am using this in my Tesla 3 to expand one of the two USB ports in the console. It takes little space and the 90°/180° Degree Rotation allowed me to use it and not cover the other post in the console. I got the 2.0 version because the ports in the car are only USB 2.0.
customer_reviews.author: Mort23

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain for small useful gadget.
customer_reviews.text: Some of the USB top edge ports on old desktop died. This works on the one remaining: it carries a dongle for mouse, an external USB 2.0 drive, and sometimes additiional USB drive for booting install, etc. I have put a few sticky pads under the unsupported end cuase I am sometimes rough with plug ins!! [I have moved it around - works fine - but it don't need to.]
customer_reviews.author: EducatedGuy

customer_reviews.title: broke so easily! my husband left it in his computer
customer_reviews.text: broke so easily! my husband left it in his computer, put it in his backpack, (totally his fault) and it snapped right away. The plastic is just cheap. After that, we got this one instead and it was fabulous: (just copy and paste the title and search for it on amazon): MAKETECH Ultra Slim Aluminum 4 Port Rotatable USB 3.0 Hub with Swiveling Connector for Mircosoft Surface, Macbook, Ultrabook and Laptop (Black)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Little Hub
customer_reviews.text: My Desktop Computer has only 4 USB slots at the rear, I had no space to plug my mouse, and keyboard and other accessories ... I purchased this 4-Port Mini USB 2.0 Rotatable Hub in order to access more ports. This Sabrent 4-Port Mini USB 2.0 Rotatable Hub is a very good little hub that takes up very little space. The aluminium body makes it sturdy and strong, and aesthetically pleasing. I plugged it to the rear of my PC, plugged my devices in it and forgot all about it. This HUB works fine and I have no regrets to date. I have no hesitation in recommending this 4-port hub. Time would tell about its durability.
customer_reviews.author: Kalip

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. There’s nothing wrong with the first one. I bought this to have as a spare because it is indispensable for me. About a year and a half ago I bought a new laptop from HP for traveling. It’s a great machine, except it only has one USB port and I do almost all my work on flash drive‘s. It’s a great device. Nothing to do with a device but I will say that as a frequent Amazon shopper, being asked to review every single thing I buy is getting very annoying. Mostly I just ignore them, but thought I would speak up for this little thing
customer_reviews.author: Shakespeare

customer_reviews.title: died 2 months after purchase
customer_reviews.text: At first it was good, the swivel feature made it easy to use no matter what position I held my laptop in and let me adjust it to stay out of the way of the power cord plugged. However, one of the 4 USB slots never worked and 2 months later it refuses to work at all, the computer you try it in give a message of device has malfunctioned and cannot be recognized.
customer_reviews.author: zenpond

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and placed it on the side of laptop that sits on my desk. It only had two devices plugged in it and it sits stationary at all times. A month into it it started disconnecting so I would move it around while plugged in and two weeks after that my computer will not even recognize it. So I am back to just plugging in one device at a time. I will look for another one later.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Sabrent 4-port USB
customer_reviews.text: Awesome!! I have a Microsoft Surface Pro 3, which has 1USB port. I like the actual keyboard and mouse, so until I found this, I put up with the fight to get the tablet keyboard to pop up, this is no longer an issue. It packs well, along with my other electronics. If you need extra USB ports, I recommend this. It's perfect for my Surface Pro because it lays flat along the Pro, no cords hanging. This is important to consider, depending on what kind of device you have. The Pro's port is on the side of the tablet, so for me, it's just a little wider, the USB keyboard and mouse are recognized
customer_reviews.author: sherri dominique

customer_reviews.title: Product works well.
customer_reviews.text: This product is great in that it expands one USB port to four USB ports. However, your laptop design may affect the functionality of it. My laptop for work is a very slim profile and the USB port on the laptop is very close to whatever surface it is sitting on; therefore, it pushes on the adapter and makes the connection less solid. The product itself works extremely well and this issue is in no way the fault of the product or the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Clemsoncid6

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Two up two down. I can't seem to find a quality multiple (4) usb hub. This is the second (different brands) that I've purchased and both failed any expectations. This one disconnects for no reason. Won't stay on when plugging a second drive. Hopefully I will find one that works.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Maldonado

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for about 2 years
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for about a year and a half. I loved the way I could rotate 180 degrees. Unfortunately after my latest office move, I get no signal through the hub. I assume the connection at the rotation joint has crapped out. For the price, I’m satisfied with the product. If you want something to last longer than two years under heavy use, look elsewhere though.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Howles-Banerji

customer_reviews.title: Great USB Hub
customer_reviews.text: **Updated Review** I initially rated this a 5-star product, but changed my review to a 3-star due to the construction of the hub. After having this a few days, I noticed the casing was coming apart. I checked this out and found the two plastic pieces aren't really held together by anything. I was able to fix this by adding a small drop of super glue onto each peg before putting it back together. It really isn't that big an issue, but considering the product is brand new, I didn't expect to have to fix the casing. Aside from that, it's been a great product thus far and I'd still reorder it if I need another USB hub.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Loera

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart and thick/awkward
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. Very quickly the body separated into two pieces (see the seam in the picture). The two pieces use a pin-in-hole design that makes them very difficult to get back together. The design, because of the orientation of the slots and the rotating mechanism, is very thick. I have a slim laptop and actually had to lift the laptop up to plug this in, and the hub then propped the laptop off the table. Wouldn't buy from this manufacturer again (in fact just ordered another hub because this one's useless).
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Cormier

customer_reviews.title: Great USB Port.
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my HP laptop that only had 1 accessible USB port when docked so that i could connect my phone and my wireless mouse receiver at he same time. It worked perfectly and all i had to do is plug it in no additional drivers or anything. I am able to use my mouse and download pictures from my phone to my laptop at the same time and there is no noticeable drag. The ability to rotate the 4 port makes i great for being able to set it so it does not interfere with other things on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Silly Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Super product, great price
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. They can lay flat or upright depending on your needs. I can add 4 additional USB cables to my laptop now. It has made working from home during COVID a lot easier. If you work on a pc most of the day i would suggest getting a couple of these. They are well made and extremely handy.
customer_reviews.author: Emma B.

customer_reviews.title: Waste.
customer_reviews.text: This functions well but the build quality is horrible. Honestly, if you're going to have more than two ports used at a time you're going to be watching it constantly because even the slightest strain on a cable is going to make it seem like it's going to snap the whole thing off in your computers port.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E

customer_reviews.title: Screen blacked out
customer_reviews.text: I just received about 20 min ago and my computer screen went black. I tried restarting my computer but it didn't do it properly. I tried it again one it and same thing happened. I work from home, I just inserted my headset and my mouse. Also, this messed up the dial system we use at my job, I called it to help fix, I hope it's nothing sketchy. I would not recommend purchasing this.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Crystal Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Great to use to expand your usb ports on a laptop
customer_reviews.text: It works for what I needed it for. To expand my usb ports on my laptop once in awhile. I don't leave it on the laptop all the time. Afraid I will hit it and use it when I need to. But main thing is that it does what I wanted it to do. .. expand my ports when needed. Small and compact too.
customer_reviews.author: justenuff

customer_reviews.title: Still doing it's job since 2015
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item back in 2015 and have had not many issues except for a couple which I will list below 1 cover comes off when i unplug a usb cable. 2 Cannot be used except for low power this like keyboards and game controllers. tried plugging a portable usb drive and no go. other then the 2 things listed above it's been worry free. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Big Canon Fan

customer_reviews.title: 4-port USB
customer_reviews.text: This is really a nice addition to my computer peripheral. Often I need more than the two USB ports that are available on my Windows 10 computer. This provides a reliable and convenient expansion to have access to 4 USB ports to my computer. Very happy that I found this flexible, and certainly so far reliable device..
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Extra ports for extra stuff
customer_reviews.text: Since some manufacturers have deemed it necessary to limit the number of usb ports this becomes a necessity. I especially like the adjustable usb connection. It doesn't seem like it would survive a banging against something accident so I intend to be careful how I treat it. But there is always super glue. Anyway, I like this product.
customer_reviews.author: william brennan

customer_reviews.title: Great for using older USB 2.0 devices on your PC/Mac!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Mac. I got a VivoFit fitness band as a gift. The problem is, the ANT connector didn't work, because all my Mac USB ports are 3.0, which confuses the older USB 2.0 technology. This was the perfect solution! It interfaces between your 3.0 port and USB 2.0 devices perfectly, and (on the Mac) sits conveniently on the back of the screen. The ONLY catch is that it's almost too wide. You'll want to put it on one of the end ports. It doesn't really fit very well between 2 other USB cables, causing strain on both. The older ANT device worked perfectly through this unit! Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Cartoon Head

customer_reviews.title: Flawed design
customer_reviews.text: The device is compact and the idea is good, unfortunately having 2 USB devices connected creates stress as one cord might be pulled lightly this creates torque on the device and this causes the connection to reset, it's a headache specially if you working with data through the USB connection. Buy a wire hub so that the pull and tug of daily use does not disconnect or reset all your devices connections.
customer_reviews.author: Rome

customer_reviews.title: works, for now
customer_reviews.text: Pros: This is exactly the form factor I was looking for. USB expansion for a Win10 based tablet (wont mention tablet by name as I really don't like it) that has 1 USB port. Unit swivels 180 degrees so it can line up with tablet edge of move to allow access to other ports located near USB port. Cons: This is not used on a day to day basis but extend use may reveal weaknesses. seemed well made but after a few turns the swivel point is very loose, despite that it still works. Other: Would buy again (and if it craps I probably will have to as this is what I was looking for)
customer_reviews.author: GKP

customer_reviews.title: No consistent connection
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this model because it came with no cords. i just want the least amount of cord but more ports. I had a hard drive crash with this device, and at first I thought it was just the hard drive, but now that I have a brand new hard drive, it now my computer is still giving me messages that my computer cannot recognize the device and this is ONLY when I have the hard drive connected. Also having a computer mouse connected to this gives me problems too.
customer_reviews.author: Vera F.

customer_reviews.title: Seems pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I just got this, so I'll update the review after I've used it awhile. My USB mouse and number keypad work when plugged in to the port (yay!) but it seems to be made kind of flimsy which is why it only got 4 stars. On the plus side, it was under $7, so I don't expect something of the finest quality.
customer_reviews.author: BookNerd

customer_reviews.title: Handy & Convenient OTG USB Hub
customer_reviews.text: This item is a low cost USB Hub. It operates as intended although its transfer speeds are limited. Being small and rotatable makes it very convenient for tight areas. It is a bit fragile so care is needed to insure long-term use. This is just a really cool OTG USB hub. Great for flash drives and peripherals such as keyboards, mice and fly remotes. This hub is good for convenient multi-device use on the fly. I would not recommend this for external hard drives or other high powered or high speed devices. HooToo (sold by Sunvalleytek) has many good low-cost, high-speed USB 3.0 hubs.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L.

customer_reviews.title: Needed for a long time.
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient, the host USB jack rotates to lay long ways flat (horizontal) . I had to build a small block equal to the host USB jack stand-off space to support less strain when pulling or installing USB cables into the four position hub. No problem! I luv it!
customer_reviews.author: GoatDriver62

customer_reviews.title: Died after less than a month of use.
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say, it was fine and then it died. Every time I try to use it I get an error that the USB device is malfunctioning (see image). I picked this one because I liked how compact and easy it was to travel with due to the absence of cords. Unfortunately, none of that matters if it doesn't work.  ̄\_(ツ)_/ ̄
customer_reviews.author: Roach

customer_reviews.title: It broke in less than 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in May and last week it completely fell apart. I am so sad since my work computer only has two ports. I need a mouse, flash drive and one more to charge my phone. I really hope this was a fluke. Update: Customer Service saw my review and contacted me. They reminded me that the product came with a warranty and promptly sent out a replacement. I even got to deal with the same person! If I ever need anything else I'll be sure to check these guys out again!
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Damage
customer_reviews.text: I just got a new laptop and it only had one USB port, so I bought this... little did I realize that it couldn’t lie flat and slightly bent my USB port. I ordered a different brand and that’s working well, but I wish I had realized this would do damage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Could only plug one device in. What good is a 4 port hub if you can't use all the ports? Good thing it was so cheap. Too lazy to send it back. Not worth the effort to box it back up and drive over to ups or the post office or wherever.
customer_reviews.author: tklamb64

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this since it was a design that didn't have wires dangling from it. I purchased this on May 15th; today is July 10th and it just completely stopped working. It wasn't dropped or damaged- it just stopped for whatever reason. I know it's not my mouse or wireless keypad because if I connect the usbs directly into the compute, then they work. I guess you get what you pay for. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Princess 28

customer_reviews.title: Great lil usb hub
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? It’s great, does what it is supposed to do. Bought it for Echo Auto to plug into and not lose what I had. I have the echo auto, micro usb charger, I pod and USB thumb drive for music in my 2015 Highlander and they all work great!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmbo

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for chromebook and ThinkPad
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: After just a couple weeks, my love affair with this inexpensive solution to my think pad, and my chromebook's lack of enough USB ports .... WE ARE PARTING WAYS - it works, it just is too flimsy, twists and falls out if you are on the move, and my primary purpose was to provide all the storage my lightweight chrombook lacked with USB tiny thumb drives.\ NEED A REAL USB HUB/PORT to get the necessary performance and accuracy of data passing back and forth. WORKS FLAWLESSLY on an Acer Chromebook, as well as Lenovo ThinkPad. Kinda flimsy construction, but worth the low price if you are just a casual user.
customer_reviews.author: JonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: This thing is smaller than I thought and that's not a bad thing. It's compact to where it's not in the way and still gives you 4 extra ports and looks professional. The rotation is a great bonus as you can basically 'get it out of the way' better. My only drawback is that I wish it stayed a little more securely and not want to flop around. Check out the uploaded video to see what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: Steph L

customer_reviews.title: Not bad,  could be better made.
customer_reviews.text: Plug in and start using! It was that simple! This really helps when your laptop only has two USB ports and you need more. I was a bit disappointed in the way it felt in hand. Could have been better. But if it holds out, then it was well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: This is a neat product
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play convenience. Fits right into my laptop USB port and swivels from horizontal to vertical to horizontal, "locking" into those three postitions. The hub is not bulky and it fits fairly close to the laptop case. It has a little blue light that indicates it is plugged into the USB. It has four USB ports which is very convenient for connecting my external drives(s) and for charging other devices. I really like this hub and will purchase again if the need should arise.
customer_reviews.author: ceedee

customer_reviews.title: Good but would be great with more space between slots.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for to connect multiple usb or printer other devices. I have used the flat one's but some usb's are to wide to put next to each other. This fits most of my usb's except for the one's with attached covers, maybe just a little more space between slots would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Falinrok

customer_reviews.title: Works.
customer_reviews.text: I've had no problems with my unit, although it sits a tad looser in the slot than I'd like. I have two laptops side-by-side, and it allows me to plug USB devices into the laptop on the right by lifting the ports above the edge of the laptop on the left. Build quality is adequate. Rotates smoothly and clicks into place in each of its three positions (0°/90°/180°).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT USB Hub, specially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Only reason why I'm giving it 4.8 stars is that if it wiggles a bit or whatever, my computer makes the noise that it's been disconnected but then reconnects instantly. It's kinda loose, but that's the ONLY reason why this isn't perfect It does its job, I have 2 USB dongles connected (wireless mouse and Bluetooth radio) on it and it works just fine. I love that this can rotate (even if it's just to certain angles) since I can move it one way or the other so it doesn't cover up any other ports or anything like that. And for the price? They're throwing the house out the window
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Policarpo

customer_reviews.title: Eh. Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I loved how compact this was, but ultimately it was too flimsy and the quality was not good. I had issues with devices occasionally not being recognized when plugged into it (but worked just fine with other usb ports). It eventually broke after about 8 months of use and I was pretty happy at the excuse to buy a new one. Interestingly, I bought one that supported usb 3.0 made by the same company for around the same price and it was far superior. I have never had issues with it. It doesn't have the compact design, but it turns out I prefer things that work.
customer_reviews.author: Josie F.

customer_reviews.title: a great solution
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to keep from plugging in wires and unplugging them each day when I wrapped up using my computer. This unit allows me to keep four attachments connected to one place and it doesn't add an extra wire to my crowded desk.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce W Fong

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 2 months until it died
customer_reviews.text: wanted to attach 4 USB drives to it, but finally it became unusable
customer_reviews.author: Peter Fleming

customer_reviews.title: very glad I got the aluminum version
customer_reviews.text: The main purpose for buying this was so I could have a wireless mouse, keyboard, and extra USBs attach to my Surface Pro 3. I am very, very glad I got the aluminum version. It doesn't feel cheap and so far has functioned well. My only complaint (and why one star was knocked off) is that the USB ports are very tight right now. This means I have to hold the hub against my Surface with one hand and use the other to pull out the USB, otherwise the hub will come off the Surface before the USB will come out of the hub. This, however, should ease up over time. Being able to adjust it is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Taylor

customer_reviews.title: With this Sabrent 4-port USB it rotates over the memory stick with a perfect match leaving the leaving the internet port open in
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few USB ports with a cord that didn't work after awhile. I'm hoeing that this one will last awhile. My wife has a laptop with only two USB ports which put limits on what one could do. Once it is plugged in it rotate 160 degrees. She has a short 64 GB memory stick she uses for back up. With this Sabrent 4-port USB it rotates over the memory stick with a perfect match leaving the leaving the internet port open in case she has to use it. This is just what the doctor prescribed.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: This is what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have to said I have the Dell venue 11 Pro and it's comes with 1 Full size USB an when I connect my phone to the computer using PDA net I noticed the signal keep dropping so I figured it was the wire nope etc it was the USB port the flash drive work good with it but I glad I purchased this so the connection won't drop :)!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Deja Lee

customer_reviews.title: Don't know yet.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed with this product as the unit does not rotate after you plug it in. Where it sits on the front of my computer, there is a lip that doesn't let it sit well. The plugs in the back are not accessible so I wanted an extension in the front. Even though the light is on showing that it has power, anything more than one insert will not work so I can do that without this product. I'm attributing this problem to the lip on my computer until I can test it with another computer to be sure. Like the idea but if only one plug works at a time, not what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: It is nice that it swivels so you can keep it out ...
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to. It is nice that it swivels so you can keep it out of the way. If you have long, heavy cords plugged into this, keep in mind that with the swivel joint and with it simply being plugged into a USB port, it may start to bend a bit or fall out. I have a keyboard, headset, and a wireless mouse dongle plugged into this thing all the time and it works just fine. I keep the cords tucked into a slot in my monitor stand to prevent the weight of the cords from pulling too much
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great seller!  I recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: The product was exactly what I wanted. The packaging was great and it arrived in perfect condition. It got here fast and was a great p try I’ve to boot. I recommend both the product and the seller
customer_reviews.author: DAllard

customer_reviews.title: Lights up, but doesn't charge anything
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give it less than 1 star. Right out of the box, the light on the 4-port lights up, but none of the many cords for various appliances show that the device is charging. Worthless plugged directly into a cube that's in an outlet, too. Pity. Seems like the technology should be so simple.
customer_reviews.author: Château

customer_reviews.title: works well and I love that it can rotate depending on where my laptop ...
customer_reviews.text: works well and I love that it can rotate depending on where my laptop is or where my usb outlets are...for someone that would have them only on the back being able to turn this horizontally is key. Pros: 1. plug and play of course 2. 4 outlets 3. ability to rotate Cons: 1. wish it was SS USB 2. sometimes I need to unplug it and plug back in to get it to recognize peripherals
customer_reviews.author: CynKB

customer_reviews.title: Does its job well, feels cheap, but overall satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: What more can I say? It's exactly what I was looking for. Four port usb expansion, it doesn't have any cable, just a direct plug in, and it even swivels slightly. It feels hella cheap, and I'm trying to be as gentle as possible with it to keep it from breaking, but it was the only usb expansion that had the form factor I was looking for, and so far, it's done everything I need of it. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Fahren

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for use in car stereo (didn't want to wear ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for use in car stereo (didn't want to wear out the single USB jack on the stereo which serves as connection point for a USB stick with my music, iPhone for daughter's music and iPad for son's music). With all of that plugging and unplugging, it would be easier to replace this than the jack on the car stereo. It tends to wobble a bit and occasionally loses its connection. But connections is rapidly restored. It can be side heavy but since it rotates that's not much of an issue. I'm just hopeful that the connections in the rotating base are study, that appears to be the weak point.
customer_reviews.author: Slappy

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This product was very easy to install. The head turns 90 degrees, providing the flexibility to align the ports vertically or horizontally, so you do not cover any buttons or additional ports. At first I was concerned because the construction appears quite light, but after actually using it the device seems sturdy. I've attached three devices via the hub, and there has been no problem supporting the weight, no sign that the hub will slip out of the port. At the price I paid ($ 6.99) a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: BookMan

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because my new work computer only came with two USB ports and I needed three or more. Works well and has a relatively low profile. The swivel USB plug is very convenient and the faint blue glow is cool.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and Low Profile!
customer_reviews.text: My new laptop only has two USB ports, so this little thing has been a real lifesaver. It seems to work as quickly as the original USB port, and it has a relatively low profile, so it doesn't get in my way. I admit to being a recliner in front of the TV laptop user, so if the port were bulky, it would be quite annoying. It appears to be fairly rugged, and you can't beat it for the price to gain three extra ports. It seems that everything runs on USB these days. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: The Librarian

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product,fours ports take the space of one. Haven't run into power problems or dead ports that often happen with these products. I have so many things that need to be charged by usb,its great to have this product to help take up less space when plugging them in and the rotation feature is very handy..i am very satisfied,this product makes life easier,thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: No more pull this one out put this one in
customer_reviews.text: This works great now I have extra space to add attachments to these ports. I have my fitbit needs two ports, wireless keyboard. etc. I really like that you can twist it to fit the port of your choice. If it didn't have this feature it would cover up my headset and microphone plugins. If a friend needed one for their computer I would highly recommend this 4-port.
customer_reviews.author: icanbme41

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: I like the product. Its simple and small. It didnt work out for me as i wanted to use this on tv and connect my fire tv stick. It just kept on restarting the fire tv stick but my chromecast works good. I have given 5 stars for design, size and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Whizkid

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Flimsy, Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Even for Sabrent, this is pretty bad. The rotating part just spins and flops around loose. If you need it to stay in a particular orientation, this is not the product for you. If you're looking for something durable and sturdy to carry around in your laptop bag, this is not the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

product_meta.title: Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub [90°/180° Degree Rotatable] (HB-UMN4)
product_meta.description: Color:BlackAdd up to 4 devices quickly and easily with the Sabrent USB 2. 0 Rotatable Hub. Great for newer notebooks that come with a limited number of ports. Maximize your time by obtaining access to plug in multiple USB devices instead of having to choose just one . Achieve full 480 Mbps on each port, or daisy-chain multiple hubs to a maximum of 127 devices. Fully backwards compatible with the USB 1. 1 products. Please Note: For a stable connection, the devices connected to the 4 Port Hub must not exceed a combined current of 5 volts 500mAh. External hard-drives should be connected to an external power source. This 4 Port hub will not charge your devices, it will only sync them. Package contents: Sabrent Rotatable 4 Port USB 2. 0 HUB
feature_bullets: Lightweight design enables the hub to be compact and portable
USB Connector Can be Rotated 90°/180° Degrees
Easy Setup, Plug-n-Play, Hot Swappable, Hot Pluggable
Instantly Add Four USB 2.0 Ports to Any Compatible Device

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars6,709 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
